Class NeonRelay

java.lang.Object
com.quietterminal.projectneon.relay.NeonRelay
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lifecycle, AutoCloseable
public class NeonRelay extends Object implements AutoCloseable, Lifecycle
Neon protocol relay server. Routes packets between hosts and clients in a completely payload-agnostic manner. Implements Lifecycle for clean start/stop semantics.

  • Nested Class Summary

      public void stop()
      Description copied from interface: Lifecycle
      Stops the component gracefully. Transitions from RUNNING to STOPPING, then to STOPPED. Waits for pending operations to complete up to the configured timeout.

    • run

      public void run() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Runs the relay processing loop. Call start() first to initialize the relay.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • startAndRun

      public void startAndRun() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Starts the relay and runs the processing loop. Combines start() and run() for convenience.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • processPackets

      public int processPackets() throws IOException
      Processes incoming packets. Returns the number of packets processed.
      Throws:
      IOException
